paper_abstract: This paper is about how to efficiently evaluate partially-dimensional range queries, which are often used in many actual applications. If the existing multidimensional indices are employed to evaluate partially-dimensional range queries, then a great deal of information that is irrelevant to the queries also has to be read from disk. A modification of R*-tree is described in this paper to ameliorate such a situation. Discussions and experiments indicate that the proposed modification can clearly improve the performance of partially-dimensional range queries, especially for large datasets.
paper_title: Efficient evaluation of partially-dimensional range queries using adaptive R*-tree
